intro: Gymnosporia rufa, commonly known as the red globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red, woolly bracts that surround its yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Gymnosporia rufa typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of desert flora.
